intro: Spiesia grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange cyathia, which are specialized inflorescences typical of the genus. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Spiesia grandiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant and distinctive flowers.
